ai-mn36:35-37.2_0: Aggivessana, I don’t occupy my mind.
ai-mn36:35-37.3_0: And with the fading away of rapture, I remained even-minded, mindful, and aware.
ai-mn36:35-37.3_1: And when I experienced the noble ones with this body,
ai-mn36:35-37.3_2: ‘One is even-minded, mindful, and abides in bliss.’
ai-mn36:35-37.4_0: Aggivessana, I don’t occupy my mind.
ai-mn36:35-37.5_0: With the giving up of pleasure and pain, and the ending of former happiness and sadness, I entered and remained in the fourth absorption, without pleasure or pain, with pure equanimity and mindfulness.
ai-mn36:35-37.6_0: Aggivessana, I don’t occupy my mind.
ai-mn36:38.1_0: When my mind had become immersed in samādhi like this—purified, bright, flawless, rid of corruptions, pliable, workable, steady, and imperturbable—I extended it toward recollection of past lives.
ai-mn36:38.2_0: I recollected many kinds of past lives, with features and details.
ai-mn36:38.2_1: When I passed away from that place I was reborn somewhere else. There, too, I was named this, my clan was that, I looked like this, and that was my food. This was how I felt pleasure and pain, and that was how my life ended. When I passed away from that place I was reborn here.’ And so I recollected my many kinds of past lives, with features and details.
ai-mn36:39.1_0: This was the first knowledge, which I achieved in the first watch of the night.
ai-mn36:39.2_0: Ignorance was destroyed and knowledge arose;
ai-mn36:39.2_2: While meditating diligent, keen, and resolute.
ai-mn36:39.3_0: Aggivessana, I don’t occupy my mind.
ai-mn36:40.1_0: When my mind had become immersed in samādhi like this—purified, bright, flawless, rid of corruptions, pliable, workable, steady, and imperturbable—I extended it toward knowledge of the death and rebirth of sentient beings.
ai-mn36:40.2_0: With clairvoyance that is purified and superhuman, I saw sentient beings passing away and being reborn—inferior and superior, beautiful and ugly, in a good place or a bad place. I understood how sentient beings are reborn according to their deeds ...
ai-mn36:41.1_0: This was the second knowledge, which I achieved in the middle watch of the night.
ai-mn36:41.2_0: Ignorance was destroyed and knowledge arose;
ai-mn36:41.2_2: While meditating diligent, keen, and resolute.
ai-mn36:41.3_0: Aggivessana, I don’t occupy my mind.
ai-mn36:42.1_0: When my mind had become immersed in samādhi like this, I extended it toward knowledge of the ending of defilements.
ai-mn36:42.2_0: I truly understood: ‘This is suffering’ ... ‘This is the origin of suffering’ ... ‘This is the cessation of suffering’ ... ‘This is the practice that leads to the cessation of suffering.'
ai-mn36:42.3_0: I truly understood: ‘These are defilements’ ... ‘This is the origin of defilements’ ... ‘This is the cessation of defilements’ ... ‘This is the practice that leads to the cessation of defilements.’
ai-mn36:43.1_0: Knowing and seeing like this, my mind was freed from the defilements of sensuality, desire to be reborn, and ignorance.
ai-mn36:43.2_0: When it was freed, I knew it was freed,
ai-mn36:43.3_0: and I understood that birth had come to an end, the spiritual life had been lived, the job had been done, there was no further state of existence.
ai-mn36:44.1_0: This was the third knowledge, which I achieved in the last watch of the night.
ai-mn36:44.2_0: Ignorance was destroyed and knowledge arose;
ai-mn36:44.2_2: While meditating diligent, keen, and resolute.
ai-mn36:44.3_0: Aggivessana, I don’t occupy my mind.
ai-mn36:45.1_0: Aggivessana, I recall teaching the Dhamma to an assembly of many hundreds,
ai-mn36:45.3_0: that I am teaching the Dhamma especially for them.
ai-mn36:45.4_0: But it should not be seen like this.
ai-mn36:45.5_0: The Realized One teaches others only so that they can understand.
ai-mn36:45.6_0: When that talk is finished, I still, settle, unify, and immerse my mind in samādhi internally, using the same meditation subject as a foundation of immersion that I used before, which is my usual meditation.”
ai-mn36:45.7_0: “I’d believe that of Master Gotama, just like a perfected one, a fully awakened Buddha.
ai-mn36:45.8_0: Does Master Gotama recall having in the middle of the day?”
ai-mn36:46.1_0: “I do recall that in the last month of the summer, I have spread out my outer robe folded in four and lain down in the lion’s posture—on the right side, placing one foot on top of the other—mindful and aware.”
ai-mn36:46.2_0: “Some ascetics and brahmins call that a deluded abiding.”
ai-mn36:46.3_0: “That’s not how to define whether someone is deluded or not.
ai-mn36:46.4_0: But as to how to define whether someone is deluded or not,
ai-mn36:46.5_0: listen and attend closely, I will speak.
ai-mn36:47.1_0: “Whoever has not given up the defilements—corruptions that lead to future lives and are hurtful, resulting in suffering and future rebirth, old age, and death—is deluded, I say.
ai-mn36:47.2_0: For it’s not giving up the defilements that makes you deluded.
ai-mn36:47.3_0: Whoever has given up the defilements—corruptions that lead to future lives and are hurtful, resulting in suffering and future rebirth, old age, and death—is not deluded, I say.
ai-mn36:47.4_0: For it’s giving up the defilements that makes you not deluded.
ai-mn36:47.5_0: The Realized One has given up the defilements—corruptions that lead to future lives and are hurtful, resulting in suffering and future rebirth, old age, and death. He has cut them off at the root, made them like a palm stump, obliterated them so they are unable to arise in the future.
ai-mn36:47.6_0: Just as a palm tree with its crown cut off is incapable of further growth,
ai-mn36:47.7_0: in the same way, the Realized One has given up the defilements so they are unable to arise in the future.”
ai-mn36:48.1_0: When he said this, Saccaka said to the Buddha,
ai-mn36:48.2_0: He said, “It’s incredible, Master Gotama, it’s amazing!
ai-mn36:48.3_0: When Master Gotama is repeatedly attacked with inappropriate and intrusive criticism, the complexion of his skin brightens and the color of his face becomes clear, just like a perfected one, a fully awakened Buddha.
ai-mn36:48.4_0: I recall taking on Pūraṇa Kassapa in debate.
ai-mn36:48.5_0: He dodged the issue, distracting the discussion with irrelevant points, and displaying annoyance, hate, and bitterness.
ai-mn36:48.6_0: When Master Gotama is repeatedly attacked with inappropriate and intrusive criticism, the complexion of his skin brightens and the color of his face becomes clear, just like a perfected one, a fully awakened Buddha.
ai-mn36:48.7_0: I recall taking on Makkhali Gosāla,
ai-mn36:48.12_0: He dodged the issue, distracting the discussion with irrelevant points, and displaying annoyance, hate, and bitterness.
ai-mn36:48.13_0: When Master Gotama is repeatedly attacked with inappropriate and intrusive criticism, the complexion of his skin brightens and the color of his face becomes clear, just like a perfected one, a fully awakened Buddha.
ai-mn36:48.14_0: Well, now, Master Gotama, I must go.
ai-mn36:48.15_0: I have many duties, and much to do.”
ai-mn36:48.17_0: Then Saccaka, the son of Jain parents, having approved and agreed with what the Buddha said, got up from his seat and left.
ai-mn36:48.18_0: The sixth section on the Long Division is finished.
